results.title: The English language: patterns of usage
results.brief_description: The words a person uses, their pronunciation, the construction of phrases and sentences, dialects and speech rhythms are all aspects of usage and style. In this film we see how speech styles and acceptability vary with individuals and culture groups, and in different language situations.

results.title: The English inn
results.creator_credit: Muriel Baker, James Carr, Sydney Box and Verity Films
results.brief_description: The inn is the centre of life in the towns and villages of England. Carved designs and paintings by artists of long ago can still be seen today in these inns. Most of the more pretentious inns were built along the old coaching routes, where they formed a vital part of the communication system.

results.title: English, French and Dutch explorations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Age of Discovery”.
Outlines the reasons behind the explorations of Cabot, Verrazano, Cartier, Frobisher, Hudson, Drake and Raleigh, the routes followed, and how their expeditions affected North America. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: English criminal justice
results.brief_description: An explanation of court procedure in England, showing the various types of courts and their particular functions. The cases range from a simple Petty Sessions case to a murder trial at the Old Bailey.
results.description: An explanation of court procedure in England, showing the various types of courts and their particular functions. The cases range from a simple Petty Sessions case to a murder trial at the Old Bailey.

results.title: An English county: Surrey
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A portrait of Surrey, showing towns, villages, hills and riversides, recalling places of historical association and familirar beauty spots, and revealing some lesser-known features of the county. Includes scenes of Box Hill, Leith Hill, Friday Street, Shere and Abinger Hammer.

results.title: England's wealth from wool
results.creator_credit: Basic Films and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Illustrates the extent of sheep farming in Britain in the early Middle Ages, from the beginning of the export trade in wool through to the Industrial Revolution and the gradual introduction of machine methods into the wool industry.

results.title: England's Shakespeare
results.brief_description: A study of Stratford-on-Avon, the birthplace of William Shakespeare, the greatest English dramatist. This town is now the site of the Shakespeare Memorial Theatre, a place of interest to students and tourists from all over the world.

results.title: The England of Elizabeth
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, Edgar H. Anstey, Ian Ferguson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A.L. Rowse, the eminent historian, has written, “The Elizabethan Age is not something dead and apart from us…Wherever one goes in England there are visible memorials of what those men and women were when they were alive, houses they built, things they made and wore, objects they cherished, patterns they imposed upon the very landscape.” Some of the visible traces as well as something of the spirit of that England of Elizabeth I, Drake, Raleigh and Shakespeare, are recorded in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Taylor, Edgar H. Anstey, Ian Ferguson and British Transport Films

results.title: England: home and beauty
results.brief_description: Domestic architecture, interior furnishing and the design of household objects were the subject of a protracted debate during the 1930’s. To increase Britain’s export sales, standards of design had to be raised, but there was no consensus for either of the two contenders-Bauhaus and Swedish inspired functionalism on the one hand or the jazzy modernistic Art Deco style on the other
